grants.name: FEMA Emergency Management Performance Grant (EMPG)
grants.notes: Core funding source for state emergency management. SOS could partner with state EMAs as technology provider.
grants.sosStrategy: Position SOS as eligible technology expense under EMPG allowable costs

grants.name: EDA FY2025 Disaster Supplemental - Industry Transformation Path
grants.eligibility: Nonprofits, institutions, governments in disaster-affected areas
grants.notes: Strong fit for disaster tech innovation. Industry Transformation path ideal for SOS.
grants.sosStrategy: Apply under Industry Transformation for disaster coordination technology

grants.name: Conrad N. Hilton Foundation - Disaster Relief & Recovery
grants.eligibility: Nonprofits, NGOs working in disaster response
grants.notes: Explicitly funds 'innovations that strengthen disaster response'. Perfect fit for SOS mission.
grants.sosStrategy: Pitch SOS as innovation strengthening community-based disaster coordination

grants.name: Google.org Crisis Response & Community Resilience
grants.notes: $60M+ donated to 50+ humanitarian orgs since 2005. Strong tech focus aligns perfectly.
grants.sosStrategy: Emphasize AI/tech coordination platform, request Google.org Fellowship support

grants.name: Rockefeller Foundation - Climate Resilience Initiative
grants.notes: $50M Adaptation & Resilience Fund launched Aug 2025. Focus on early warning systems.
grants.sosStrategy: Position SOS as climate disaster coordination enabling community resilience

grants.name: Skoll Foundation - Skoll Award for Social Entrepreneurship
grants.eligibility: Social entrepreneurs with proven track record
grants.notes: $300M+ awarded to social entrepreneurs. Stabilization/disaster recovery is focus area.
grants.sosStrategy: Apply once MVP is proven with early state partnerships

grants.name: MacArthur Foundation - Climate Solutions / 100&Change
grants.notes: Climate Solutions winding down but 100&Change continues. Massive opportunity if timed right.
grants.sosStrategy: Monitor for next 100&Change round; prepare transformative disaster coordination proposal

grants.name: Bezos Earth Fund - AI Grand Challenge for Climate & Nature
grants.eligibility: Organizations using AI for climate solutions
grants.notes: $10B commitment by 2030. 24 Phase I grants awarded May 2025. Strong AI focus.
grants.sosStrategy: Apply for Phase II focusing on AI-powered disaster coordination and prediction

grants.name: Schmidt Futures / Schmidt Sciences - Climate & Resilience
grants.notes: $1.8M announced for AI + climate projects with Quadrature Climate Foundation.
grants.sosStrategy: Pitch SOS as tech infrastructure for disaster coordination moonshot

grants.name: Walmart Foundation - Disaster Preparedness & Response
grants.notes: Funded Tulane DRLA $550K, SBP disaster resilience fellows. Strong disaster focus.
grants.sosStrategy: Partner with established disaster org for joint proposal

grants.name: Gordon & Betty Moore Foundation - Wildfire Resilience
grants.notes: Strong wildfire resilience focus. SPARK program supports accelerator models.
grants.sosStrategy: Pitch SOS wildfire coordination module as extension of resilience tech

grants.name: Open Society Foundations - Emergency Relief
grants.notes: $130M committed to COVID response. Emergency funding during crises.
grants.sosStrategy: Position SOS as equity-focused coordination tool for marginalized communities

grants.name: Climate Resilience Fund - Climate Smart Communities Initiative
grants.notes: Accepting applications now through March 2026. Ideal for pilot communities.
grants.sosStrategy: Partner with community applying for CSCI grant, provide SOS as coordination tool

grants.name: Nature Conservancy - Climate Resilience Grant Program
grants.notes: Sixth round of program. Good entry point for smaller grants.
grants.sosStrategy: Apply for pilot in nature-disaster intersection (wildfire, flood zones)

grants.name: ClimateWorks - Adaptation & Resilience Fund
grants.notes: Launched Aug 2025 with Rockefeller, Howden, Laudes, Quadrature. Early warning focus.
grants.sosStrategy: Pitch SOS as early warning coordination layer for community resilience

grants.name: Center for Disaster Philanthropy - Managed Funds
grants.notes: Manages funds for corporations/foundations. Good connector to multiple funders.
grants.sosStrategy: Engage CDP as potential fund manager or introducer to corporate donors

grants.name: USAID Humanitarian Grand Challenge
grants.notes: SHIFT Prize awarded 2025. Watch for next challenge round.
grants.sosStrategy: Apply to next Grand Challenge round with proven MVP

grants.name: FEMA Nonprofit Security Grant Program (NSGP)
grants.notes: Primarily for physical security but can include coordination technology.
grants.sosStrategy: Minimal fit unless positioning as security coordination tool

grants.name: Peace of Mind Foundation - MHPSS for Disaster-Affected Children
grants.notes: Niche focus but could fund mental health coordination module.
grants.sosStrategy: Potential future module for mental health resource coordination

grants.name: Gates Foundation - Emergency Response
grants.notes: Flexible emergency funding for major disasters. Health/epidemic focus.
grants.sosStrategy: Position SOS for health emergency coordination (future epidemic response)

grants.name: WFP Innovation Accelerator (Google.org Partnership)
grants.notes: Google.org granted $2.8M to WFP accelerator. Strong tech support.
grants.sosStrategy: Apply to accelerator cohort with food/resource distribution coordination angle

grants.name: Council on Foundations - Disaster Grantmaking Network
grants.notes: Not direct funder but valuable connector to disaster-focused foundations.
grants.sosStrategy: Join network, attend convenings, build funder relationships

grants.name: Start Network Platform Integration
grants.notes: Hilton Foundation awarded $1M for platform integration of local orgs.
grants.sosStrategy: Explore technology partnership - SOS could integrate with Start Network

grants.name: Echoing Green Fellowship
grants.notes: Jonathan could apply as founder. Strong network and validation.
grants.sosStrategy: Apply to next fellowship cycle for founder support and network

grants.name: Ashoka Fellowship
grants.notes: Prestigious network of social entrepreneurs. Requires proven impact.
grants.sosStrategy: Target after MVP success and initial state partnerships

priorityRecommendations.name: Hilton Foundation
priorityRecommendations.rationale: Perfect mission alignment, explicitly funds disaster coordination innovation, strong fit score (9)

priorityRecommendations.name: FEMA EMPG
priorityRecommendations.rationale: States receiving this funding could use SOS as eligible technology expense - indirect but large opportunity

priorityRecommendations.name: Google.org
priorityRecommendations.rationale: Tech focus perfect for SOS, potential Fellowship support, strong disaster response track record

priorityRecommendations.name: Bezos Earth Fund AI Challenge
priorityRecommendations.rationale: AI component of SOS aligns with fund focus, Phase II coming with larger awards

priorityRecommendations.name: EDA Disaster Supplemental
priorityRecommendations.rationale: Clear deadline (March 2026), Industry Transformation path ideal for disaster tech
